RunTimeCompiler.IProjectReader Interface Reference

This interface defines a way of working with project-reader. Currently the only project-reader developed is the one for c# projects, but many other readers can be developes for various languages/IDEs. More...

Inheritance diagram for RunTimeCompiler.IProjectReader:

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

bool CanOpen (string filename)
 This method will be used to check if the specified project file can be opened. Implementations may involve operations like: checking the file extension, reading the file header (or some specific sectors) and getting the file version. Note! If the call returns true it does not guaranties calls to ReadProject will be successfull.
BasicProject ReadProject (string filename)
 This method will be used to read a project file and extract all the data needed for the UI and for compilation.

Detailed Description

This interface defines a way of working with project-reader. Currently the only project-reader developed is the one for c# projects, but many other readers can be developes for various languages/IDEs.

Member Function Documentation

bool RunTimeCompiler.IProjectReader.CanOpen ( string  filename  ) 

This method will be used to check if the specified project file can be opened. Implementations may involve operations like: checking the file extension, reading the file header (or some specific sectors) and getting the file version. Note! If the call returns true it does not guaranties calls to ReadProject will be successfull.

Parameters:
filename The name of the project file. It should include path (absolute or relative).
Returns:
True if the project-reader "beleaves" he can read the project file.

Implemented in RunTimeCompiler.CsprojReader.

BasicProject RunTimeCompiler.IProjectReader.ReadProject ( string  filename  ) 

This method will be used to read a project file and extract all the data needed for the UI and for compilation.

Parameters:
filename The name of the project file. It should include path (absolute or relative).
Returns:
All the data needed for UI and compilation

Implemented in RunTimeCompiler.CsprojReader.
